page.title: 11EDUCATION IN HASTINGS
page.content: Most children start full time education when they are 5 when they go to their local primary school. Here they will be in a class of about 30 children. They will learn a mixture of subjects but when they leave at 11 they should have skills in language and maths. Then they go to a comprehensive school. There are 4. Each has about 1,400 pupils. All stay till they are 16 and may until they are 18. Two of the schools are mixed, one is all boys and the other all girls. Some young people leave school and take full time courses at Hastings college where much of the work is to train for employment. Those wishing to study for degrees go to Universities and Polytechnics throughout Britain.
